thread.title: Lotto winner scoops $18 million after striking Powerball
thread.title_full: Lotto winner scoops $18 million after striking Powerball

title: Lotto winner scoops $18 million after striking Powerball
text:
Lotto winner scoops $18 million after striking Powerball Last updated 20:42, February 4 2017 MICHAEL BRADLEY/LOTTO NZ 
What would you do with $18 million? 
A Lotto player from Otago is $18 million richer after striking the Powerball. 
The winning ticket was sold on MyLotto, with the prize being made up of $18 million from the Powerball first division and an extra $250,000 from the Lotto First Division. 
It's the first Powerball win of 2017, with the ultimate jackpot struck three times during the month of December last year. 
Three other Lotto players are also in the money after winning $250,000 each. 
Those tickets were sold at Feilding Video Centre in Feilding, Tony's Stationery and Lotto in Maungaturoto and on MyLotto to a player from New Plymouth. 
Strike Four rolled over and will be worth $300,000 on Wednesday.
